result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby Harold Hall

records.addlTxt:
10:54 AM Defendant Bobby Harold Hall in court, in custody.  Attorney Tim Kiefer in court for Bobby Harold Hall.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status. Attorney Kiefer notes that a bail motion has been filed. Attorney notes that the defendant is on $5,000 cash but cannot post. Notes there are outstanding warrants that would need to be taken care. Asks for $200 cash and would be starting drug court in MN. He could resolved MN cases first. State objects to the reduction and notes 7 FTAs in MN and WI cases. State notes severity of the charges and is currently on probation. State is concerned about going to MN and fears he may not return to face charges. 
Court reviews the charges pending and notes concerns over outstanding warrants and being on probation. Court denies motion for bail reduction.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:16 PM Defendant Bobby Harold Hall appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Questions defendant on counsel. Defendant indicates has not applied with public defender's office. Court advises to get attorney. Defendant wishes to go forward with preliminary hearing on Wednesday.
No contact with ALME, MCS or their residence.  No contact with co defendant MP. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:42 PM Defendant Bobby Harold Hall appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Ryan Reid. Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. 
Judge notes that counts 1 and 2 refer to defendant, 3 and 4 to different defendant.  (2 defendants one complaint)
Not guilty plea(s) entered. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. Defendant's address confirmed. 
State requesting $5000 cb No contact with ALME, MCS or their residence. No contact with co defendant MP. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Reviews criminal history; recent failures to appear
Attorney Reid-local resident for some time, request $2000cb
Court-Orders $5000cb No contact with ALME, MCS or their residence.  No contact with co defendant MP. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.
